net.openhft.chronicle.engine.api.tree

Interface Asset

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    SubAsset<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    VanillaAsset, VanillaSubAsset

    public interface Asset
extends net.openhft.chronicle.core.io.Closeable
    An Asset is a point on an AssetTree. An Asset can not only have any number of Children it has multiple views depending on how you want to access the data.

    A single asset can have a MapView, EntrySetView, KeySetView, ValuesCollection, Subscription, TopicPublisher. A Map may be viewed in terms of the objects it holds e.g. String or Marshallable or the raw data i.e. as a BytesStore.

        Returns:
        the Subscription
        Throws:
        AssetNotFoundException - if the Subscription doesn't exist and the tree is not able to create the Subscription.

      • findOrCreateView

        @Nullable
default <V> V findOrCreateView(@NotNull
                                         Class<V> viewType)
                                  throws AssetNotFoundException
        Search up the tree for a view of viewType. If one doesn't exist find a factory and add it to the asset the factory is associated with. This view can then be shared for the Assets under the Asset where the factory is defined.
        Parameters:
        viewType - to obtain.
        Returns:
        the view it could be created
        Throws:
        AssetNotFoundException

        Returns:

      • acquireView

        @NotNull
default <V> V acquireView(@NotNull
                                   RequestContext requestContext)
                            throws AssetNotFoundException
        Get or create a view based on a RequestContext. First it looks for a matching viewType(). If found this is returned.
        Parameters:
        requestContext - to use in the construction of the view
        Returns:
        the View obtained.
        Throws:
        AssetNotFoundException - if the Asset could not be created. This can happen if a required rule is not provided.

      • acquireView

        @NotNull
<V> V acquireView(Class<V> viewType,
                           RequestContext requestContext)
                    throws AssetNotFoundException
        Get or create a view based on a RequestContext. First it looks for a matching viewType(). If found this is returned. The viewType given overrides the type provided in the RequestContext.
        Parameters:
        viewType - to obtain.
        requestContext - to use in the construction of the view
        Returns:
        the View obtained.
        Throws:
        AssetNotFoundException - if the Asset could not be created. This can happen if a required rule is not provided.

      • acquireView

        @NotNull
default <V> V acquireView(Class<V> viewType)

        Parameters:
        viewType - to obtain.
        Returns:
        the View obtained.
        Throws:
        AssetNotFoundException - if the Asset could not be created. This can happen if a required rule is not provided.

<V> V getView(Class<V> viewType)
        Get a view if it already exists on the current Asset.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • registerView

        <V> void registerView(Class<V> viewType,
                      V view)
        Provide a specific implementation of a view
        Parameters:

        view - implementation of viewType to use.

      • addLeafRule

        <V> void addLeafRule(Class<V> viewType,
                     String description,
                     LeafViewFactory<V> factory)
        Add a rule or factory for creating view on demand. A Leaf rule doesn't need any view to exist before you create it. This can be used for building the fundamental data structure which represents this Asset.

        If two rules with the same description are provided, the new factory will replace the old. At present, any new factory replaces the old one, however in the future we may support multiple factories.
        Parameters:
        viewType - interface to associate this factory with.
        description - of the factory
        factory - to create a viewType

      • addWrappingRule

        <V,U> void addWrappingRule(Class<V> viewType,
                           String description,
                           WrappingViewFactory<V,U> factory,
                           Class<U> underlyingType)
        Add a rule or factory for creating views on demand. A Wrapping Rule need an underlying view to wrap before it can be created. This can be used for laying functionality on existing views.

        If two rules with the same description are provided, the new factory replaces the old one. Note: if rules with different descriptions are provided, they are called in ASCIIbetical order of the description.

        If a factory returns null, a later factory will be called.
        Parameters:
        viewType - class of the view.
        description - to use to comment on the view, determine order of factories and detect duplicates.
        factory - to use to create the view. If the factory returns null, the next factory is called.
        underlyingType - the underlying view type required.

      • addWrappingRule

        <V,U> void addWrappingRule(Class<V> viewType,
                           String description,
                           java.util.function.BiPredicate<RequestContext,Asset> predicate,
                           WrappingViewFactory<V,U> factory,
                           Class<U> underlyingType)
        Add a rule or factory for creating views on demand. A Wrapping Rule need an underlying view to wrap before it can be created. This can be used for laying functionality on existing views.

        If two rules with the same description are provided, the new factory replaces the old one. Note: if rules with different descriptions are provided, they are called in ASCIIbetical order of the description.

        If the predicate returns false or a factory returns null, a later factory will be called.
        Parameters:
        viewType - class of the view.
        description - to use to comment on the view, determine order of factories and detect duplicates.
        predicate - to test whether this factory applies.
        factory - to use to create the view. If the factory returns null, the next factory is called.
        underlyingType - the underlying view type required.

      • addView

        <V> V addView(Class<V> viewType,
              V view)
        Add an implementation of a view to the asset.. This can be used instead of, or in addition to adding rules.
        Parameters:
        viewType - to associate this implementation with.
        view -
        Returns:
        the view provided.

      • isSubAsset

        boolean isSubAsset()
        Returns:
        true if this is a simplified Asset attached to a keyed Asset. E.g. if you subscribe to a key in a Map this key uses a SubAsset.

default Asset root()

           throws InvalidSubscriberException
        Iterate of all the children of this Asset.
        Parameters:
        childAcceptor - to accept each child.
        Throws:
